summary: Willem Oltmans was a person of interest due to his contacts with Cuban and Soviet diplomats. Cables from 1977 report on his meetings and contacts with these diplomats, as well as his travel to the USSR and Cuba. A significant aspect of the interest in Oltmans stems from his past association with George de Mohrenschildt, a figure connected to Lee Harvey Oswald. The cables suggest conveying information about Oltmans to Congressional authorities, indicating that his activities and connections were considered relevant to inquiries related to the JFK assassination.
significance: Willem Oltmans' significance in the JFK assassination context arises from his association with George de Mohrenschildt and his contacts with Cuban and Soviet diplomats. These connections raised concerns and prompted the CIA to monitor and report on his activities, particularly in relation to Congressional inquiries into the assassination.
